alert.note: Alert for Dubuque (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 22 at 9:17PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Iowa... Mississippi River from Dubuque downstream to Burlington affecting all of the counties bordering the Mississippi River. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Dubuque LD11. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Water affects Volunteer Drive leading to Lock and Dam 11. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 19.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 22.9 feet Saturday April 29th. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning.
